H0.text: Sulfur (S), nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and bromine (Br) are noble (inert) gases.

H1.text: They are nonmetals, as is true for the elements sulfur (S), nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and bromine (Br).

H2.text: They (sulfur, nitrogen, phosphorus, and bromine) have the same thermal conductivity.

H3.text: They have the same number of protons, a property common to sulfur (S), nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and bromine (Br).

A4.text: Noble gases are nonmetals, including helium, neon, argon, krypton, xenon, and radon.

A5.text: Nonmetals include sulfur, nitrogen, phosphorus, and bromine.
